text:
Unpopular opinion: Our society seems to be in a state of heightened pedophilia-panic, assuming that anyone with attractions towards children are a threat to children. However, research shows that most individuals with pedophilic tendencies DO NOT ACT ONE THEM, and many cases of child sexual abuse are committed by people who DO NOT MEET the clinical definition of pedophilic disorder. Violence or punishment are not the answer, and it will never be the answer because they do not address the root causes or prevent future harm. In fact, stigma and isolation increase risk by pushing pedophiles away from support systems that might help them manage their impulses safely.

If we want to protect children effectively, we need to move beyond fear and toward support and evidence-based approaches that focus on real prevention, education, and mental health support. I do not care if you call me a pedophile either because I know that I actually want to protect children. I understand that non-pedophiles are responsible for most cases of abuse. I have solutions‚Äîmost of you don‚Äôt. And frankly, many of you are part of the problem.
author: @phillipdennis8590
